page.title: 12THE CIVIC CENTRE
page.content: The building is{8 years old}on the {11th November 1985.}The{Duke of {Norfolk}opened it. There are 4 main offices in the building, 33 people per office. The Civic Centre is like a jungle because everywhere you walk there are plants - in the basement, in the large hall, up stairs and in the big office. The offices are 250 sq.yds There are an awful lot of jobs. The car park can hold up to 300-350 cars. 488 people are employed but only 130 work in the actual building. The people work for 39 hours a week, for 5 days a week. They get over 1000 letters a week. They now use a lot of computers and they are buying more and more each year. They are really changing the way they work. The Civic Centre is on a hill to keep it safe from floods and so that people whose homes are flooded can stay there.
